mbostock@gmail.com.message:
Expose projection.rotation.

This is useful if you want to specify the center in non-rotated coordinates.

Add polyfill for mouseenter and mouseleave.

Fixes #931.

Merge pull request #1077 from calvinmetcalf/master

add colorbrewer global name
Format for readability.

Allow d3.map to be used with d3.nest’s map.

You can now pass a map type to d3.nest’s map function. For example, if you pass
d3.map as the second argument to nest.map(array, type), the returned value will
be an instance of d3.map rather than a bar object. In addition to offering
better protection against built-in property names, d3.map offers more convenient
iteration methods.
Merge branch '3.0.6'
Merge branch 'geo-area-fast' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'fix-axis-tick-class' into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'fix-format-round' into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'fix-wheel' into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'fix-voronoi-for-prototype' into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'capture-globals' into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'fix-force-drag' into 3.0.6
Merge branch 'fix-sort-null' into 3.0.6

Don’t expose d3_functor for link properties.

Fixes #895.
Fix for invalid axis.orient. Fixes #905.

Sort null nodes at the end.

Previously, null nodes were passed to the comparator and were indistinguishable
from non-null nodes with no bound data. For consistency with other selection
operators that skip null nodes, it seems preferrable to put null nodes at the
end of the selection rather than passing them to the comparator. Fixes #881.
Merge branch 'force_layout_keeps_userbits_intact' of https://github.com/GerHobbelt/d3 into fix-force-drag

Capture d3, as well.

This allows multiple instances of D3 to be loaded, or the d3 variable to be
renamed without breaking code. Fixes #1058.
Make sure drag behavior is instantiated.
Merge branch 'force_layout_exports_drag' of https://github.com/GerHobbelt/d3 into fix-force-drag
Bump up line-to-pixel multiplier to 120.

Avoid Prototype’s broken array.filter.

While I abhor Prototype’s practice of replacing native methods with broken non-
native ones, this is a painless fix that allows us to use d3.geom.voronoi on
nytimes.com, which shamefully continues to use Prototype.

Use µ rather than μ.

That is, MICRO SIGN (\xb5) rather than GREEK SMALL LETTER MU (\u03bc).

Fix wheel events; fixes #1048 #1047.

Some time ago the hidden div scroll trick stopped working. But, this went nearly
unnoticed because most browsers are fairly well behaved since WebKit fixed bug
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=40441 back in June 2010. All that
remained broken was Firefox, who adopted the newer W3C "wheel" event standard.
This commit removes the old div hack, and does better support detection to
determine the most standards-based approach to listening for wheel events.
Fix rounded format specifier; fixes #1042.

jason@jasondavies.com.message:
Fix d3.geo.interpolate for coincident points.

This also improves accuracy for small distances, using the haversine
distance formula instead of the law of cosines.

Fixes #1080.
Add test case for tiny Polygon area.
Fix a couple of edge cases.

tommy@southdesign.de.message: using an evaulation array for accessor functions and ignoring NaN, undefined and null
refactored results with NaN array and empty arrays to fit the results of R
added exit criteria for variance that returns NaN on an empty array
Added Variance and Corrected Standard Deviation to core array functions.

john.firebaugh@gmail.com.message:
Add d3.set

Taking inspiration from d3.map, d3.set is a simple shim for ES6 sets.

ziggy.jonsson.nyc@gmail.com.message: Ignore arguments length.  Return target if and only if the returned value is the source.
Rebind returns target when the source returns itself (i.e. chain rebound)
